title: Why does Aurelion Sol not have taunts and interactions with Veigar?
body:
{{champion:45}}  is a Cosmic Mage and has the most space themed abilities in the game yet a **COSMIC DRAGON WHO MAKES STARS** has nothing to say to a guy who **TRAPS PEOPLE IN A BLACK HOLE CAGE** or **BLASTS THEM WITH A GALAXY**

okay {{champion:33}}

replies.body:
The thing is that Veigars magic doesn't really look that cosmic,it is easily possible that veigar(or rather the rioters who designed him) just named his abilities after cosmic stuff simply because it sounds cool.

Also if anything veigars space magic centers around the 3-dimensional space,not the outer space,so its something entirely different.

>
> The thing is that Veigars magic doesn't really look that cosmic,it is easily possible that veigar(or rather the rioters who designed him) just named his abilities after cosmic stuff simply because it sounds cool.

But his lore DO mention that he is in fact, a corrupter of the cosmic energies and he uses that kind of magic... Sure that the spells may look outdated, but it doesnt means that he isnt a cosmic user.

Huh you are right.

However I think that riot simply isn't sure how they'll categorize veigars magic once they'll take a look at him,they might retcon that part,they might enhance on that theme.

And about Veigar, before the lore of Poppy/Aurelion and the quotes of Ilaoi, Veigar was less powerfull than Syndra... or at the same lvl. But Now? From the lore of Poppy we learned that Yordles are creatures with magical afinity that can live for centuries, wich makes him more experienced than Syndra. Illaoi calls the yordles "Spirits", it would confirm even more that the yordles (and Veigar) are inmortals... 

If that is true, the greatest weakness of Veigar (his mortal body) would dissapear. As an inmortal spirit that can corrupt the cosmic energies, i would say that he is way more powerfull than Syndra... and maybe even Xerath.

> From the lore of Poppy we learned that Yordles are creatures with magical afinity that can live for centuries, wich makes him more experienced than Syndra. Illaoi calls the yordles "Spirits", it would confirm even more that the yordles (and Veigar) are inmortals... 
> 
> If that is true, the greatest weakness of Veigar (his mortal body) would dissapear. As an inmortal spirit that can corrupt the cosmic energies, i would say that he is way more powerfull than Syndra... and maybe even Xerath.

I think you may be overlooking a pretty important aspect added alongside with the Poppy lore: The Yordles seem to be fundamentally different in their perception of the world.

Take Poppy, who is incapable of grasping her own nature as the fabled hero of Demacia. It is perfectly within the realm of possibility that Veigar, by his nature as a Yordle, is just incapable of wielding cosmic magic in a way that alllows him to surpass Syndra or other major magical threats of Runeterra, even if he technically is more powerful.

The thing with Poppy. She has self-esteem issues. Or has them as long as Orlon is concerned. She admired him so much that she immediately rejects the idea of being his chosen.

That twist could be applied to a human and work the same, it has nothing to do with yordle stupidity. Poppy just lives longer.

I'd personally rather not go with a "yordles are inherently mentally disabled" explanation. Poppy being retconned into being mentally slow and undeveloped is one thing, but the entire race? Ugh.

it's probably not due to them being slow, but rather likely has to do with their race getting beaten into the ground by every other race for thousands of years. i mean, all of the noteworthy yordles that do not live exclusively in bandle are known for their technological advancements and not their individual magic or physical power. even the yordles in bandle likely have a bad representation of individual strength based on what they use and do. rumble uses a mech, trist has a gun, lulu has a fairy following her and probably giving her all of her powers. and then you have veigar and poppy, the two yordles that use their own power, and they both have problems with themselves, veigar has gone insane due to noxian capture and torture, and poppy has problems with self image, as she will likely never consider herself a true demacian hero regardless of what she does because she will always be a yordle.

Where does it say that they were beaten to the ground for years though?

We know they live in their own lands away from humans to the point their first showing is a pivotal part of their life, a 'revealing'.We know that they are inherently magic, good-natured, quite whimsical (but not dumb :/) and weak to isolation. Also brilliant mixers of magic and technology.

Where were they beaten to the ground though? Their hidden society suggests the opposite.

Well, his lore is quite old, perhaps Riot will want to take him in a different direction.

...Though I fear that they may either make him into either a complete joke or a serious grimdark edgelord. What I like about Veigar is the fact that he's hopelessly incompetent at being evil while at the same time being one of the most powerful beings in the world.

Veigar fits to me perfectly under the term "crouching moron, hidden badass." He is loud, obnoxious, lashes out at any percieved joke at his expense and hopelessly incompetent at his evil schemes. But back him into a corner, push those jokes just a bit too far and he will show why he is the (tiny) Master of Evil. 

Any lore rewrite would in my opinion have to keep this aspect in mind, so in that sense I agree with what you say.
